title: Jannas Winrate will NEVER drop as long as ADCs are as OP as they are.
body:
Well, unless you nerf her so hard she becomes literally useless. 

Janna is the only support specificly designed around supporting the ADC, as long as shes viable and has that one job, she will always have the top winrate, until the game is not decided by who has the strongest ADC any more. 

And ADC with a Janna behind him will always be stronger than an ADC without a Janna behind him, because making the ADC stronger is her one job.

replies.body:
> Well, unless you nerf her so hard she becomes literally useless.

I'm currently exploring some Janna changes that aim to increase the viability of her offensive outputs so that her defensive ones can be toned back a bit. The hypothesis is that by improving her offensive potency and playmaking potential, she won't need to be so supremely good at being a shield/peel bot for her ADC. Interested to see how it plays out.

Oh, and the changes we're testing now doesn't look very similar to the one that was talked about a few weeks ago, for what that's worth.

i don't think you need to make her an offensive champion, just give her more interesting ways to peel than a guaranteed pushback with R and a targeted 3 second slow. 

or at least not _direct_ offense, but maybe things like charged tornadoes applying her passive MS to allies who walk in its path

I think she'd have a long way to go from being what she is now to being an offensive champion. She could hypothetically be significantly more offensive than she is now and still be ~75% defensive in nature or something.
In other words: She should not be balanced around damage. She's not meant to be a damage dealer although she can deal some damage given an AP build which i find disgusting thinking of.
every champion should have the capability to deal damage, especially if they build for it
Yes but not every champion should be balanced around dealing damage is what i'm saying in this case.

Good sir OP, are you aware of the marksmen's damage and survival conditions? I shall remind you for the sake of discussion.

They must not have someone standing ontop of them and they must not take too much damage, preferably they must also not be CC'ed.


Now i ask, what exactly is Janna as specialist at doing?  Shields to prevent damage and boost the marksmans damage, heals, to keep the healbar up in the green,  a knockback to prevent engages, and a knockup to disrupt any and nearly all attacks. 


She has everything marksmen need of a support to succeed, the peeling, the healing, the shielding and the CC'ing.


Even a garbage marksman that knows what to build and how to move around can succeed with a good janna protecting them.

Assassins are negated, divers are nearly all negated (except those with unstoppable abilties) mages are severely reduced in terms of effectiveness and tanks are prevented from gapclosing on the marksman.


All this done by Janna, she reduces the threat lvl of a enemy team towards her marksman extremely well just by default. 

Why? Because she covers all the weaknesses of the class, lack of mobility, lack of durability, lack of self peel and lack of dive prevention.


It's not that Janna will always be good as long as marksmen are, rather, marksmen will always be good as long as Janna is. 


This is what we call carrying.

Then why exactly isnt Lulu right there on top with Janna?

If the reason you listed were responsible for Jannas high winrate, Lulu should be there too, since she does all these things as well and as good as Janna.

Janna is superior in terms of forcing multiple people to back of and her movespeed is higher and range is better.


In short, lulu is much easier to bully in lane or catch out later on.


Range makes a huge difference, as does the need to act for success, Janna doesn't actually have to stress anything in particular whilst lulu needs to run around. 


Then the difference in abilties, janna doesn't need to stay around to deal damage, she just uses E on her marksman, then looks to land her Q and ulting whenever it's opportune,  doing those are basically her win conditions and she can do it from fairly high away.


Lulu has to land her shorter and slower Q, go in range for her W and her ultimate loses in terms of effectiveness vs janna's. She might also need to go in range for auto attacks to help her marksman break through janna's shield before the difference in AD causes too much damage.

Janna has fewer and easier win conditions, that's why it´s kinda hard to fail playing her, because you hardly have to exert yourself until the enemy divers or assassins try something.


Altho i would say that Lulu is potentially more rewarding she is also a higher risk to play, but that's why her winrates remain lower. 


Kinda like a debate on which midlaner is better, Ori or Syndra,  Syndra is great when wanting to smash lane and snowball but ori just needs to hang on and she´ll be tremendously useful just by her basic toolkit.  Thus you´d call Ori more useful in general.

Lulu can't push away whole enemy team at once, she can't even push it away at all, all she has is slows, polymorph and very conditional long cooldown knockup. She can't heal her whole team either, also she isn't as mobile as janna is, neither she increases her whole team's speed.
